item.title: Pras add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Most people are other people. Their thoughts are someone else's opinions, their lives a mimicry, their passions a quotation." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Pras add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Pras add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Pras add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Pras add a quote by Leon C. Megginson
item.description: "It is not the strongest of the species that survives, nor the most intelligent, but the one most responsive to change." -- Leon C. Megginson

item.title: Pras add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description:
"Seven Deadly Sins
Wealth without work Pleasure without conscience Science without humanity Knowledge without character Politics without principle Commerce without morality Worship without sacrifice." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Pras add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "History will be kind to me for I intend to write it." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Pras add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Goodbye," said the fox. "And now here is my secret, a very simple secret: It is only with the heart that one can see rightly; what is essential is invisible to the eye." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Pras add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "You will always be fond of me. I represent to you all the sins you never had the courage to commit." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Pras add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything, and the value of nothing." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Pras add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "Everyone thinks of changing the world, but no one thinks of changing himself." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Pras add a quote by William Shakespeare
Pras add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Pras add a quote by Horace Mann
item.description: "A house without books is like a room without windows." -- Horace Mann

item.title: Pras add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "A good friend will always stab you in the front." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Pras add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Yes: I am a dreamer. For a dreamer is one who can only find his way by moonlight, and his punishment is that he sees the dawn before the rest of the world." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Pras add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "Without deviation from the norm, progress is not possible." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Pras add a quote by Woody Allen
item.description: "To you, I'm an atheist. To God, I'm the loyal opposition." -- Woody Allen

item.title: Pras add a quote by Arnold Lobel
item.description: "Books to the ceiling, Books to the sky, My pile of books is a mile high. How I love them! How I need them! I'll have a long beard by the time I read them." -- Arnold Lobel

item.title: Pras add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "God has no religion." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Pras add a quote by tan malaka
item.description: "Bila seseorang ingin menaiki tangga sosial dan kebudayaan mestilah merdeka lebih dulu dan pengetahuan tentang kemerdekaan, di Baratlah dilahirkan dan dipergunakan." -- tan malaka

item.title: Pras add a quote by Pramoedya Ananta Toer
item.description: "Orang boleh pandai setinggi langit, tapi selama ia tidak menulis, ia akan hilang di dalam masyarakat dan dari sejarah. Menulis adalah bekerja untuk keabadian." -- Pramoedya Ananta Toer

item.title: Pras add a quote by Pramoedya Ananta Toer
item.description: "Kalian boleh maju dalam pelajaran, mungkin mencapai deretan gelar kesarjanaan apa saja, tapi tanpa mencintai sastra, kalian tinggal hanya hewan yang pandai." -- Pramoedya Ananta Toer

item.title: Pras add a quote by Bumi manusia-Pramoedya Ananta Toer
item.description: "Berbahagialah dia yang makan dari keringatnya sendiri, bersuka karena usahanya sendiri, dan maju karena pengalamannya sendiri." -- Bumi manusia-Pramoedya Ananta Toer

item.title: Pras add a quote by Jared Diamond
item.description: "Perhaps our greatest distinction as a species is our capacity, unique among animals, to make counter-evolutionary choices." -- Jared Diamond

item.title: Pras add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "Science is not only compatible with spirituality; it is a profound source of spirituality." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Pras add a quote by Carl Sagan
item.description: "Science is a way of thinking much more than it is a body of knowledge." -- Carl Sagan

item.title: Pras add a quote by Napoleon Bonaparte
item.description: "Religion is excellent stuff for keeping common people quiet. Religion is what keeps the poor from murdering the rich." -- Napoleon Bonaparte

item.title: Pras add a quote by Napoleon Bonaparte
item.description: "Never interrupt your enemy when he is making a mistake." -- Napoleon Bonaparte

item.title: Pras add a quote by Napoleon Bonaparte
item.description: "Show me a family of readers, and I will show you the people who move the world." -- Napoleon Bonaparte
